name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-chlorophenyl and trifluoromethyl functionalities significantly impact the melting point. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The phenyl group introduces additional rigidity and pi-system interactions, estimated at around +30°C for each additional fused ring. The trifluoromethyl group introduces additional rigidity and van der Waals forces, estimated at around +10°C for each trifluoromethyl group. The presence of three fluorine atoms increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +10°C for each fluorine atom.
